name: B. AccurateLee
statement:
The string s he found is a binary string of length n (i. e. string
consists only of -s and -s).In one move he can choose two consecutive
characters s_i and s_{i+1}, and if s_i is and s_{i + 1} is , he can
erase (he can choose which one to erase but he can’t erase both
characters simultaneously). The string shrinks after erasing.Lee can
make an arbitrary number of moves (possibly zero) and he’d like to make
the string s as as possible. He thinks for two different strings x and
y, the string is cleaner, and if they are the same length, then the
string is cleaner.Now you should answer t test cases: for the i-th test
case, print the cleanest possible string that Lee can get by doing some
number of moves.Small reminder: if we have two strings x and y of the
same length then x is lexicographically smaller than y if there is a
position i such that x_1 = y_1, x_2 = y_2,..., x_{i - 1} = y_{i - 1} and
x_i < y_i.
